{"uri": "8115531953", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-07", "time": "12:18:06", "dateTime": "2024-05-07T12:18:06Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-07T12:17:51Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8352941274642944, "url": "https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-13391363/prince-harry-arrives-uk-without-meghan-invictus-games-meet-king-charles.html", "title": "Prince Harry arrives in the UK: Duke of Sussex touches down in London", "body": "Prince Harry has arrived in Britain alone today after flying in from California for a ceremony marking the 10th anniversary of the Invictus Games in London tomorrow.\n\nThe Duke of Sussex is expected to meet his estranged father the King during his trip, which follows a previous quick visit in February after Charles's cancer diagnosis.\n\nHarry is understood to have various Invictus Games commitments today, according to ITV. Tomorrow, he is set to give a reading at a service of thanksgiving at St Paul's Cathedral marking a decade since the inaugural Invictus Games in London in 2014.\n\nOrganisers had said there was no confirmation of any other royals attending, or if Harry's wife Meghan Markle or children Archie and Lilibet would also be in the UK.\n\nBut Harry arrived in London by himself today, and is expected to join the Duchess on a tour to Nigeria later this week with Meghan set to fly there from the US by herself.\n\nAnd Harry is not anticipated to see his brother Prince William, who is scheduled to be away from the capital on Thursday and Friday, or his sister-in-law Kate Middleton whose cancer treatment continues following her revealing the diagnosis in March.\n\nThe Duke has invited William and other senior members of the Royal Family to the service but none of them are expected to attend, sources told Page Six in the US.\n\nAmong the royals who could attend include his cousins Zara Tindall and Princesses Beatrice and Eugenie, but there has been no confirmation of this. Harry is expected to stay at a hotel in London because he no longer has Frogmore Cottage in Windsor.\n\nApril 12, 2024 -- Harry and Meghan at a charity polo match for Sentebale in Wellington, Florida\n\nKing Charles III leaves Windsor Castle as he heads to Clarence House in London this morning\n\nThe King is driven away from Windsor Castle this morning as he travels to Clarence House\n\nBut Charles is likely to be in London tomorrow for his usual weekly audience with Prime Minister Rishi Sunak, providing father and son with a chance to meet again.\n\nREAD MORE Moment beaming Prince Harry excitedly announces birth of his son Archie in footage filmed just months before Megxit - with couple set to celebrate his fifth birthday at home in California Advertisement\n\nAlthough Charles has been left wounded by his son's behaviour in recent years, he has always privately insisted he will keep the door open for him to at least speak.\n\nWilliam, however, is understood to find his brother's betrayal more difficult to forgive or even put to one side.\n\nThe Prince and Princess of Wales will be at Windsor where they have asked for privacy so that Kate can focus on her recovery from serious abdominal surgery and ongoing preventative chemotherapy for the cancer that was subsequently discovered.\n\nIt will be Harry's first visit to the UK since February when he returned for a brief trip to see his father the King following his cancer diagnosis.\n\nIt is also the first major event he has attended in Britain for some time and comes amid his ongoing a legal case about his personal security arrangements whenever he is in the UK.\n\nIt will also be Harry's first visit since the Princess of Wales revealed her cancer diagnosis.\n\nExperts say that while he may meet his father the King, he will unlikely meet up with Kate or Prince William.\n\nFebruary 14, 2024 -- Harry and Meghan attend an Invictus Games event in Whistler, Canada\n\nFebruary 6, 2024 -- Prince Harry arrives at Clarence House in London to visit his father Charles\n\nSeptember 16, 2023 -- Prince Harry and Meghan at the Invictus Games in Dusseldorf, Germany\n\nMay 6, 2023 -- Harry leaves Westminster Abbey after the Coronation of Charles and Camilla\n\nRoyal author Tom Bower told MailOnline: 'I'm sure he won't see Kate. {"uri": "8116953037", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "08:19:40", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T08:19:40Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T08:19:25Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7803921699523926, "url": "https://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/entertainment/celebrity/prince-harrys-sad-last-trip-32759125", "title": "Prince Harry's sad last trip to the UK: snub, hotel bed and flight home next day", "body": "Prince Harry has touched down in London to celebrate the Invictus Games 10 year anniversary this week but the last time the Duke of Sussex visited the UK, it was a much more sombre occasion.\n\nWhen the news of King Charles' cancer diagnosis broke, the 39-year-old prince rushed back home to see his father but due to the last minute nature of his trip, the father and son were only able to spend a very short time together.\n\nThey were only able to spend just 30 minutes together before the monarch left London for Sandringham to rest, having begun his cancer treatment as an outpatient.\n\nWhile Harry got some face time with the King during his visit, he is believed to have not crossed paths with his older brother Prince William, the Mirror reports.\n\nThe duke stayed in a hotel and flew straight back to California the next day where he lives with his wife Meghan Markle and their two kids, Prince Archie and Princess Lilibet.\n\nThis week, Harry won't be seeing his father because the monarch has a \"full programme\" of duties booked in, a spokesperson for the duke confirmed.\n\nThey said: \"The Duke of course is understanding of his father's diary of commitments and various other priorities and hopes to see him soon.\"\n\nInsiders have alleged that Harry and the King intended to see one another if Charles had been able to fit in a visit.\n\nDespite hopes for a royal reconciliation, it appears that Prince Harry hasn't reached out to Prince William before his UK visit.\n\nThe nation has been rocked by the news of Princess Kate's cancer diagnosis, with Harry and Meghan reportedly extending their support privately to Kate upon hearing the distressing news just before it was made public.\n\nIn a show of solidarity, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex issued a heartfelt public statement wishing \"health and healing\" for the Princess of Wales and supporting her plea for privacy during her treatment and recovery.\n\nAlthough Harry's recent trip to the UK did not include a meeting with his brother, there have been calls for the estranged siblings to mend fences in light of the Royal family's health concerns.\n\nThe possibility of a reunion between Harry and William during the Duke of Sussex's time in the UK remains uncertain, as does whether Harry will see Kate, whom he affectionately described as \"more sister than in-law, the sister I'd never had and always wanted\" in his memoir, 'Spare'.\n\nSources have confided to The Mirror that Prince Harry and King Charles have maintained communication since their last encounter, with intentions for a catch-up in the UK if the King's schedule permits.\n\nThey shared: \"Harry has kept in regular contact with his father on several occasions and made no secret of his desire to see him when he can. He has been especially concerned about him and hopes the King will be well and able to see him as planned.\"\n\nYet, it seems the timing isn't quite right for a reunion between the once-close siblings as a source said: \"Their relationship remains extremely fractured. Harry has privately expressed a wish to sit down with his brother but now is not the time\".\n\nThe brothers have seen each other only a few times since Harry stepped back from royal duties and relocated to the US.\n\nA notable occasion was their grandfather Prince Philip's funeral in 2021, shortly after Meghan and Harry's explosive Oprah interview that shook the public's view of their royal relations and led Harry to suggest that his father and brother were \"trapped\" in the monarchy.\n\nIn his memoir, Harry disclosed that post-funeral, he and William had a heated exchange, during which Charles implored them not to make his \"final years a misery\".\n\nThe duke wrote that William, who has alternated between being his \"beloved brother\" and \"arch nemesis\", couldn't fathom why Harry chose to leave the UK.\n\nThe brothers reunited once more when they revealed a statue in honour of their mother Diana in July 2021, on what would have been her 60th birthday, and then again to commemorate the late Queen Elizabeth's Platinum Jubilee in June 2022.\n\nA few months later, the brothers were drawn together again in shared sorrow as they mourned their late grandmother together, even managing to share a light-hearted moment amidst the sadness.\n\nAs they readied themselves to trail their grandmother's coffin through London's streets, both brothers were reminded of the time they had done the same for their mother when they were just children.\n\nHarry recounted in an ITV interview a few weeks later: \"Just recently my brother and I were walking the same route, and we sort of joked to each other and said, 'At least we know the way'.\n\n\"It was very similar. The only difference was the levels of emotion. Because our grandmother had finished life.\n\n\"There was more, I think, of a celebration and respect and recognition to what she had accomplished. Whereas our mother was taken away far too young.\"\n\nHarry is currently in the UK to attend a special service at St. Paul's Cathedral marking 10 years of the Invictus Games - a sports competition for wounded ex-servicepeople that Harry established in 2014.\n\nThe duke is making the journey alone, with Meghan remaining in California, before the couple set off for Nigeria on what some are calling an unofficial royal tour.\n\nReports suggest that no senior members of the House of Windsor will be present at the anniversary service of a cause dear to Prince Harry's heart.\n\nIt is also likely that Harry will once again stay in a hotel during his UK visit, rather than residing in one of the many Royal estates.\n\nIn the previous year, Harry and Meghan were asked to leave their UK residence, Frogmore Cottage, in Windsor.\n\nWithout a personal abode in the UK, Harry reportedly requested to stay in Windsor Castle in September 2023, but was denied - allegedly due to the last-minute nature of the request.\n\nSince then, Harry has been staying in hotels during his visits to his home country, amidst an ongoing disagreement with the Home Office regarding his security while in Britain.\n\nThe Sussexes lost their taxpayer-funded police protection when they stepped down as working royals, and it is now up to the royal and VIP Executive Committee to decide on a case-by-case basis whether the duke will receive police protection.\n\nSo far, the legal battle has not been in Harry's favour, but his legal team has indicated their intention to \"challenge the decision\".\n\nIn a positive turn amidst the health challenges confronting the Royal Family, King Charles has received the green light from his medical team to resume certain \"public-facing\" royal engagements.\n\nThis comes as they are satisfied with the progress he's made in his recovery.\n\nInitially restricted to managing state affairs privately, Charles won't immediately return to a full schedule of duties and his future commitments will \"remain subject to doctors' advice\".\n\nThe King's gradual comeback is set to lighten the load on Prince William, who has been juggling his role as a prominent working royal with family duties, especially considering Kate's health issues.\n\nGet the latest celebrity gossip and telly news sent straight to your inbox. The Duke and Duchess of Sussex are currently in California with their kids, Archie and Lilibet, celebrating the fifth birthday of their little prince.\n\nAccording to Quinn, many Royal aides are happy that Meghan is skipping the UK portion and meeting Harry in Nigeria for their Royal visit afterward.\n\nKing Charles Wants To Connect More With Prince Archie And Princess Lilibet\n\nQuinn also revealed to the news outlet that amid the disconnect between Harry's family and the rest of the royals, King Charles is still trying to connect with his grandkids and is \"desperate\" for a good relationship with them.\n\nHowever, the monarch is reportedly not a fan of \"new technology\" and is \"uncomfortable\" with making video calls.\n\nHe said, \"If he makes an ordinary telephone call to Harry, it means he can have a quick word with Archie without the need to talk to Meghan.\"\n\nHarry, Meghan, and Archie previously video-called the palace in April 2020 to wish the late Queen Elizabeth a happy 94th birthday.\n\nAfter Harry and Meghan retired as senior royals in 2020, there was a disconnect between their family and the rest of the Royal family. Since then, the couple has addressed the conflict in multiple projects, which has caused an even bigger divide.\n\nPrince Harry And King Charles Will Meet During The Duke's Visit\n\nBefore his UK trip this week, sources revealed that Harry was \"very keen\" to see his father. He and Charles have reportedly maintained \"regular contact\" after the monarch was diagnosed with an undisclosed form of cancer in February this year.\n\nAs he receives treatment for the cancer, Charles has finally resumed his public duties and will be present at Buckingham Palace's first garden party on Wednesday.\n\nThe party and Harry's Invictus Games anniversary service are scheduled to conclude around 6 pm, giving father and son the opportunity to meet physically for the first time since February.\n\nA source told The Sun, \"It's clear he is keen to see his father as he continues each other since Queen Elizabeth II's funeral in 2022.\n\nHowever, a source recently told US Weekly that the Prince and Princess of Wales want a \"truce\" and are \"open\" to reconciling with the Duke and Duchess of Sussex.\n\nThe source explained that William and Kate are considering mending their broken relationship with Harry and Meghan because of their children, as they don't want their feud to be passed on to \"the next generation.\"\n\nThe source stated, \"They want a relationship with Meghan and Harry, and they don't want the acrimony to carry over to the next generation.\"\n\nThe insider added that Meghan and Harry feel the same way: \"Obviously, the Duke and Duchess want their kids to have a relationship with their cousins.\"\n\nPrince Harry And Meghan Markle Are Visiting Nigeria\n\nAfter Harry's UK trip, he and Meghan will reportedly visit Nigeria. Social media users have shared that they're \"overwhelmed with joy\" for the visit and promised a warm welcome to the couple during their time in the country.\n\nThe visit comes two years after Meghan revealed that a genealogy test she did \"a couple of years\" ago revealed she is \"43 percent Nigerian.\"\n\nThe Nigerian Chief of Defence Staff invited the Duke and Duchess of Sussex when he met Harry at the last Invictus Games in D\u00fcsseldorf.\n\nOn X (formerly Twitter), one user shared their joy for the visit. {"uri": "8115584933", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-07", "time": "12:49:55", "dateTime": "2024-05-07T12:49:55Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-07T12:49:37Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7764706015586853, "url": "https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/royals/prince-harrys-sad-last-visit-32727862", "title": "Prince Harry's sad last visit to UK - snub, hotel stay and back home next day", "body": "Harry's last visit to the UK was to visit King Charles following his cancer news\n\nPrince Harry has landed in London for a special Invitus Games celebration this week, but the last time the Duke of Sussex visited his home country, it was a much more sombre occasion.\n\nWhen King Charles announced that he had been diagnosed with cancer, Harry rushed home to see his father and speak with him in person, but due to the last-minute nature of the visit, the father and son were only able to squeeze in a seriously short time together.\n\nAfter spending just 30 minutes with each other, King Charles left London for Sandringham to rest having begun his cancer treatment as an outpatient, and while Harry got some face time with his father, he is said not to have crossed paths with his elder brother Prince William during his visit.\n\nJust the next day, after staying in a hotel, Harry flew straight back home to California, where he lives with his wife Meghan and two children: Prince Archie and Princess Lilibet. This time around, sources have claimed that Harry and King Charles definitely intend to see one another again, but there may not have been much movement towards reconciliation with William, with Harry said not to have reached out to his brother ahead of his visit.\n\nA lot has changed since Harry's last visit to the UK, with Princess Kate's own cancer news sending shockwaves across the nation. Harry and Meghan are said to have reached out privately to Kate after learning the emotional announcement just before it was publicly revealed.\n\nThe Duke and Duchess of Sussex also made a public statement of support for Kate after the announcement, wishing \"health and healing\" for the Princess of Wales, and backing Kate's emotional appeal for privacy as she continues her treatment and focuses on her recovery. While Harry and William did not meet during Harry's last visit to the UK, some commentators have appealed for the brothers - who have long had a strained relationship - to reconcile amid the health challenges facing the royal family.\n\nHarry and Meghan backed Kate's appeal for privacy as she undergoes cancer treatment\n\nHowever, it is not clear yet whether or not Harry and William will reunite while he is in the UK, nor whether the Duke of Sussex will see Kate who he has previously called \"more sister than in-law, the sister I'd never had and always wanted\" in his memoir Spare.\n\nSources told The Mirror that Harry and Charles have stayed in touch since they last saw one another and they plan to meet up while he is in the UK. They said: \"Harry has kept in regular contact with his father on several occasions and made no secret of his desire to see him when he can. He has been especially concerned about him and hopes the King will be well and able to see him as planned.\"\n\nHowever, the timing apparently isn't right for the two once-close brothers to reunite. \"Their relationship remains extremely fractured. Harry has privately expressed a wish to sit down with his brother but now is not the time,\" explained a source.\n\nThe brothers have come together a handful of times since Harry stepped back as a working royal and moved across the Atlantic. Notably, the pair reunited for their grandfather Prince Philip's funeral in 2021, which came only weeks after Meghan and Harry sat down with Oprah for a bombshell interview that rocked the public perception of their relationship with the other royals and saw Harry claim that his father and brother were \"trapped\" within the monarchy.\n\nHarry revealed in his memoir that after the funeral he and William had a tense showdown, during which Charles begged them not to make his \"final years a misery\". The duke claimed that William - who has been both his \"beloved brother\" and \"arch nemesis\" over the years - said he had no idea why Harry had decided to leave the UK.\n\nThe brothers came together again when they unveiled a statue dedicated to their mother Diana in July 2021, on what would have been her 60th birthday, and then again to celebrate the late Queen Elizabeth's Platinum Jubilee in June 2022. Only a few months later the brothers were brought back together in further grief, as they mourned the late monarch together, and even managed to share a joke together in the dark moment.\n\nHarry and William have reunited in important moments for the Royal Family despite having a strained relationship\n\nAs they prepared to follow their grandmother's coffin through the streets of London, both brothers were reminded of the moment they had done the same thing for their mother, when they were only children. Harry explained in an interview with ITV a few weeks later: \"Just recently my brother and I were walking the same route, and we sort of joked to each other and said, 'At least we know the way'.\n\n\"It was very similar. The only difference was the levels of emotion. Because our grandmother had finished life. There was more, I think, of a celebration and respect and recognition to what she had accomplished. Whereas our mother was taken away far too young.\"\n\nHarry is visiting the UK to attend a special service at St. Paul's Cathedral to mark 10 years of the Invictus Games - a sports competition for wounded ex-servicepeople that Harry founded in 2014. The Duke is making the trip solo, with Meghan staying behind in California, before the couple head to Nigeria for what some have deemed an unofficial royal tour.\n\nIt has been reported that no senior members of the House of Windsor will be attending the anniversary service of the cause so close to Harry's heart and that he will likely be staying once again in a hotel during his time in the UK, rather than one of the many royal residences.\n\nLast year, Harry and Meghan were \"evicted\" from their UK home of Frogmore Cottage, in Windsor. Without a place to call home of their own in the UK, Harry is reported to have asked permission to stay in Windsor Castle in September 2023, only to have his request rejected - reportedly on the grounds that it was made too last minute.\n\nHarry is set to return to celebrate 10 years of the Invictus Games\n\nAfter this, Harry has stayed in hotels while back in his home country, amid an ongoing dispute with the Home Office over his security whilst he is on British soil. The Sussexes had their taxpayer-funded police security pulled when they stepped back as working royals, and it is now decided by the Royal and VIP Executive Committee on a case-by-case basis whether the Duke will get police security. So far, the legal battle has not gone Harry's way, but his legal team has indicated they intend to \"challenge the decision\".\n\nIn a boost amid the health crises faced by the House of Windsor, King Charles has been given permission by his doctors to return to some \"public-facing\" royal duties, because they are pleased with the progress he's made in his treatment so far. Initially, Charles was limited to conducting business of state behind closed doors, and while he won't be back to a full programme immediately - his engagements will \"remain subject to doctors' advice\". The monarch's return to duty will see some of the burdens eased on Prince William, who has had to balance being one of the most senior royals available to work with his familial responsibilities given his wife's health struggles.\n\nDo you have a story to tell? During his visit to the UK, it had been thought he could meet with his father, with whom he has a rocky bond, but it seems it is not possible.\n\nA spokesperson for the Duke said: \"It unfortunately will not be possible due to His Majesty's full programme. The Duke of course is understanding of his father's diary of commitments and various other priorities and hopes to see him soon.\"\n\nREAD MORE: Prince Archie could have had wildly different name as Harry and Meghan 'couldn't decide'\n\nHarry arrived in the capital on Tuesday, travelling without his wife Meghan Markle or their children, Prince Archie and Princess Lilibet. Earlier on Tuesday, the King was also seen leaving Windsor Castle to head to London, where he has been holding audiences at Buckingham Palace. On Wednesday, he is expected to be at a Buckingham Palace garden party - just days after his return to public duties amid his cancer treatment.\n\nHarry has had a frosty relationship with his dad, especially since he was highly critical of his royal relatives in his controversial memoir Spare - and was particularly scathing about his stepmother Camilla. He has been especially concerned about him and hopes the King will be well and able to see him as planned.\"\n\nHarry's trip to the UK is his second to the UK this year, after February's trip to see his dad a day after it was announced Charles had cancer. Harry managed to see his ailing father for just 30 minutes at Clarence House. It marked a healing step in their relationship that was dented after Harry and Meghan quit royal life in 2020 and moved to the US. An insider said: \"Their relationship remains extremely fractured. Harry has privately expressed a wish to sit down with his brother but now is not the time.\"\n\nHarry will meet up with Meghan later in the week when the pair embark on a tour of Nigeria, where they are expected to meet with military staff.\n\nThe service at St Paul's is scheduled two days after Harry's son Prince Archie celebrates his fifth birthday. Actor Damian Lewis is set to recite the Invictus poem during the service. {"uri": "2024-05-348302655", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-07", "time": "23:08:25", "dateTime": "2024-05-07T23:08:25Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-07T13:14:08Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.772549033164978, "url": "https://www.aol.com/lifestyle/prince-harry-unable-meet-dad-131408817.html", "title": "Prince Harry Unable to Meet with Dad King Charles During U.K. Visit Due to Monarch's 'Full' Schedule", "body": "Prince Harry Unable to Meet with Dad King Charles During U.K. Visit Due to Monarch's 'Full' ScheduleStephanie PetitMay 7, 2024 at 3:14 PM\n\nThe Duke of Sussex returned to his home country to celebrate 10 years of the Invictus Games\n\nPrince Harry will not meet with his father King Charles during his trip to the U.K., PEOPLE confirms.\n\nA spokesperson for the Duke of Sussex, 39, says, \"In response to the many inquiries and continued speculation on whether or not The Duke will meet with his father while in the U.K. this week, it unfortunately will not be possible due to His Majesty's full program. The Duke of course is understanding of his father's diary of commitments and various other priorities and hopes to see him soon.\"\n\nKing Charles, 75, recently resumed public royal duties after working mainly behind the scenes for several months amid his cancer diagnosis and treatment. On May 7, the monarch held an audience at Buckingham Palace, welcoming the Prime Minister of Fiji, Sitiveni Rabuka. Buckingham Palace is also set to host the first garden party of the season on May 8, although it's unknown which members of the royal family are attending.\n\nPrince Harry returned to his home country for celebrations surrounding the 10th anniversary of the Invictus Games, which had its inaugural competition for wounded, injured and sick service personnel and veterans 10 years ago in London. The anniversary is being marked with a panel on Tuesday and a service at St. Paul's Cathedral on Wednesday, where Harry will give a reading and Homeland actor Damian Lewis will recite the Invictus poem. (The writer of the poem, William Henley, is commemorated with a memorial bust in the Crypt of the cathedral.)\n\nRelated: Meghan Markle Won't Join Prince Harry in the U.K. Next Month Before Heading to Nigeria Together\n\nThe Duke of Sussex most recently visited the U.K. in February following the news of King Charles' cancer diagnosis. Prince Harry flew from California to see his father at Clarence House in London, where they had a brief private meeting.\n\nA royal source said there were \"no plans\" for brothers Prince Harry and Prince William to get together while the Duke of Sussex was in the U.K. in February. At the time, Kate Middleton was recuperating from her January abdominal surgery. On March 22, the Princess of Wales revealed that post-operative tests from the procedure \"found cancer had been present\" and she had started chemotherapy.\n\nSpeaking about the reunion with his father on Good Morning America shortly after, Prince Harry was asked how he first learned about the monarch's cancer news. He replied, \"I spoke to him. I jumped on a plane and went to go see him as soon as I could.\"\n\n\"Look, I love my family. The fact that I was able to get on a plane and go and see him and spend any time with him, I'm grateful for that,\" Harry said in the interview.\n\nRegarding his outlook on the King's health, Prince Harry said, \"That stays between me and him.\"\n\nCan't get enough of PEOPLE's Royals coverage? Sign up for our free Royals newsletter to get the latest updates on Kate Middleton, Meghan Markle and more!\n\nAs for whether King Charles' diagnosis could have a \"reunifying effect\" on the royal family, Harry, who was connecting with Invictus Games competitors and their families in Canada at the Winter Training Camp at the time, said: \"Absolutely. Yeah, I'm sure. Throughout all these families, I see it on a day-to-day basis, the strength of the family unit coming together.\"\n\n\"I have my own family, as we all do,\" he continued. \"My family and my life in California is as it is. I've got other trips planned that would take me through the U.K. or back to the U.K., so I'll stop in and see my family as much as I can.\"\n\nPrince Harry and Meghan Markle moved to her home state of California after they stepped back as working members of the royal family in 2020 and ultimately settled in Montecito. Although Prince Harry has returned to the U.K. on several occasions, including for charity events and court cases he's pursuing, he rarely reunites with King Charles or other family members.\n\nFollowing his trip to the U.K., Prince Harry and Meghan will visit Nigeria. PEOPLE previously confirmed that the Duke and Duchess of Sussex have accepted an invitation to visit the African country next month on behalf of its Chief of Defense Staff, the highest-ranking military official.\n\nFor more People news, make sure to sign up for our newsletter!\n\nRead the original article on People.", "source": {"uri": "aol.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Aol"}, He's doing some Invictus related events today.\"\n\nThe duke is set to reunite with Meghan later this week for a tour of Nigeria, where engagements with military personnel are anticipated.\n\nIn addition to the service at St Paul's, where Prince Harry will deliver a reading, there is speculation about a potential meeting with King Charles, despite their strained relationship.\n\nThe Duke's candid memoir 'Spare' released last year, did not shy away from criticising his Royal family members, including a notably harsh portrayal of Queen Camilla.\n\nA source has disclosed: \"Harry has kept in regular contact with his father on several occasions and made no secret of his desire to see him when he can. He has been especially concerned about him and hopes the King will be well and able to see him as planned.\", reports the Mirror.\n\nDespite a packed schedule next week, Royal insiders have confirmed that Charles is keen to meet with his son, who has been somewhat estranged.\n\nHarry is expected to remain in the UK for a three-day visit. This trip marks his second visit home this year, following a brief February visit to see Charles after the public learned of the King's cancer diagnosis.\n\nDuring that time, Harry was only able to spend 30 minutes with his father at Clarence House.\n\nThis meeting signalled a potential thawing in their relationship, which suffered after Harry and Meghan stepped back from Royal duties in 2020 and relocated to America. Charles, who resumed his Royal engagements last week, is slated to be in London on Tuesday for his cancer treatment.\n\nRoyal aides have noted that Charles' attendance at events is contingent on how he feels each day. The communication between Harry and his father has \"remained positive\", as revealed by a source.\n\nThe Duke has been sending supportive messages throughout his father's illness. In a recent interview on American television, Harry expressed his hope that the King's diagnosis might lead to a \"reunifying effect\" for the family.\n\nDespite the possibility of Prince Harry seeing his father, it appears a reconciliation with his estranged brother, Prince William, is not on the horizon. A source revealed: \"Their relationship remains extremely fractured. Harry has privately expressed a wish to sit down with his brother but now is not the time.\"\n\nThe service at St Paul's Cathedral will take place two days after Harry's son, Prince Archie, marks his fifth birthday. Actor Damian Lewis is poised to deliver a reading of the Invictus poem during the ceremony.\n\nThe event will also see representatives from nations participating in the Invictus Games, including {"uri": "2024-05-347792328", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-07", "time": "13:33:48", "dateTime": "2024-05-07T13:33:48Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-07T13:14:08Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7607843279838562, "url": "https://www.aol.com/prince-harry-unable-meet-dad-131408817.html", "title": "Prince Harry Unable to Meet with Dad King Charles During U.K. Visit Due to Monarch's 'Full' Schedule", "body": "Prince Harry Unable to Meet with Dad King Charles During U.K. Visit Due to Monarch's 'Full' ScheduleStephanie PetitMay 7, 2024 at 3:14 PM\n\nThe Duke of Sussex returned to his home country to celebrate 10 years of the Invictus Games\n\nPrince Harry will not meet with his father King Charles during his trip to the U.K., PEOPLE confirms.\n\nA spokesperson for the Duke of Sussex, 39, says, \"In response to the many inquiries and continued speculation on whether or not The Duke will meet with his father while in the U.K. this week, it unfortunately will not be possible due to His Majesty's full program. The Duke of course is understanding of his father's diary of commitments and various other priorities and hopes to see him soon.\"\n\nKing Charles, 75, recently resumed public royal duties after working mainly behind the scenes for several months amid his cancer diagnosis and treatment.\n\nPrince Harry returned to his home country for celebrations surrounding the 10th anniversary of the Invictus Games, which had its inaugural competition for wounded, injured and sick service personnel and veterans 10 years ago in London. The anniversary is being marked with a panel on Tuesday and a service at St. Paul's Cathedral on Wednesday, where Harry will give a reading and Homeland actor Damian Lewis will recite the Invictus poem. (The writer of the poem, William Henley, is commemorated with a memorial bust in the Crypt of the cathedral.)\n\nRelated: Meghan Markle Won't Join Prince Harry in the U.K. Next Month Before Heading to Nigeria Together\n\nThe Duke of Sussex most recently visited the U.K. in February following the news of King Charles' cancer diagnosis. Prince Harry flew from California to see his father at Clarence House in London, where they had a brief private meeting.\n\nA royal source said there were \"no plans\" for brothers Prince Harry and Prince William to get together while the Duke of Sussex was in the U.K. in February. At the time, Kate Middleton was recuperating from her January abdominal surgery. On March 22, the Princess of Wales revealed that post-operative tests from the procedure \"found cancer had been present\" and she had started chemotherapy.\n\nSpeaking about the reunion with his father on Good Morning America shortly after, Prince Harry was asked how he first learned about the monarch's cancer news. He replied, \"I spoke to him. I jumped on a plane and went to go see him as soon as I could.\"\n\n\"Look, I love my family. The fact that I was able to get on a plane and go and see him and spend any time with him, I'm grateful for that,\" Harry said in the interview.\n\nRegarding his outlook on the King's health, Prince Harry said, \"That stays between me and him.\"\n\nCan't get enough of PEOPLE's Royals coverage? Sign up for our free Royals newsletter to get the latest updates on Kate Middleton, Meghan Markle and more!\n\nAs for whether King Charles' diagnosis could have a \"reunifying effect\" on the royal family, Harry, who was connecting with Invictus Games competitors and their families in Canada at the Winter Training Camp at the time, said: \"Absolutely. Yeah, I'm sure. Throughout all these families, I see it on a day-to-day basis, the strength of the family unit coming together.\"\n\n\"I have my own family, as we all do,\" he continued. \"My family and my life in California is as it is. I've got other trips planned that would take me through the U.K. or back to the U.K., so I'll stop in and see my family as much as I can.\"\n\nPrince Harry and Meghan Markle moved to her home state of California after they stepped back as working members of the royal family in 2020 and ultimately settled in Montecito. Although Prince Harry has returned to the U.K. on several occasions, including for charity events and court cases he's pursuing, he rarely reunites with King Charles or other family members.\n\nFollowing his trip to the U.K., Prince Harry and Meghan will visit Nigeria. PEOPLE previously confirmed that the Duke and Duchess of Sussex have accepted an invitation to visit the African country next month on behalf of its Chief of Defense Staff, the highest-ranking military official.\n\nFor more People news, make sure to sign up for our newsletter!\n\nRead the original article on People.", "source": {"uri": "aol.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Aol"}, "title": "Brutal reason Charles won't meet with son during Harry's UK visit", "body": "Prince Harry will not be catching up with his father King Charles III this week as he makes a brief visit to the UK for commitments regarding the Invictus Games.\n\nThe Duke of Sussex landed in London on Tuesday, travelling from his home in California without wife Meghan Markle and children Prince Archie and Princess Lilibet.\n\nHe has returned to the UK's capital to take part in a number of events connected to the Invictus Games, which is celebrating its 10th anniversary after Harry established the multi-sport tournament for servicemen and women and veterans in 2014.\n\nA meeting between Harry and Charles appeared likely during the visit, with a source hinting last week the King would make time to see his son.\n\n\"Harry has kept in regular contact with his father on several occasions and made no secret of his desire to see him when he can,\" the source said.\n\n\"He has been especially concerned about him and hopes the King will be well and able to see him as planned.\"\n\nA spokesperson for Harry has shut those reported plans down however, with Charles' schedule too packed to squeeze in a reunion.\n\n\"It unfortunately will not be possible due to His Majesty''s full programme,\" the spokesperson said.\n\n\"The Duke of course is understanding of his father's diary of commitments and various other priorities and hopes to see him soon.\"\n\nThe pair last met in February at Clarence House when Harry flew back to the UK quickly following his father's cancer diagnosis.\n\nIt was their first meeting in-person in 16 months and it lasted just 45 minutes, with Harry flying back out just 24 hours later.\n\nDespite the briefness of the exchange, it was a sign the father-son relationship was in the midst of being repaired after it turned frosty with the release of Harry's memoir Spare, which was highly critical of the royal family.\n\nThe relationship between Harry and older brother Prince William remains \"extremely fractured\" though, according to a source who revealed the younger sibling expressed an interest in reuniting with the Duke of Cambridge.\n\n\"Their relationship remains extremely fractured. Harry has privately expressed a wish to sit down with his brother but now is not the time\", the source said.\n\nUpon his arrival in London on Tuesday, the Duke of Sussex visited Armoury House and took part in a panel discussion hosted by Louise Minchin, where he reflected on the first decade of the Invictus Games.\n\n\"I think we've just had a huge amount of fun. I think that I personally have learned so much from the people that I have met,\" he said.\n\n\"The children, the family, the friends, the individuals themselves, and the amount of respect and admiration I have for all of them just continues to build just year after year after year.\n\n\"And now we have these Invictus One Year to Go events as well because, to be honest with you, we can't wait two years!\"\n\nOn Wednesday, Harry will attend the 10th anniversary service of the Games at St Paul's Cathedral. The anniversary is being marked with a panel on Tuesday and a service at St. Paul's Cathedral on Wednesday, where Harry will give a reading and Homeland actor Damian Lewis will recite the Invictus poem. (The writer of the poem, William Henley, is commemorated with a memorial bust in the Crypt of the cathedral.)\n\nThe Duke of Sussex most recently visited the U.K. in February following the news of King Charles' cancer diagnosis. Prince Harry flew from California to see his father, 75, at Clarence House in London, where they had a brief private meeting.\n\nA royal source said there were \"no plans\" for brothers Prince Harry and Prince William to get together while the Duke of Sussex was in the U.K. in February. At the time, Kate Middleton was recuperating from her January abdominal surgery. On March 22, the Princess of Wales revealed that post-operative tests from the procedure \"found cancer had been present\" and she had started chemotherapy.\n\nSpeaking about the reunion with his father on Good Morning America shortly after, Prince Harry was asked how he first learned about the monarch's cancer news. children.\n\nThey have since become estranged from the rest of the royal family and Harry is said to be barely on speaking terms with his elder brother, heir to the throne Prince William.\n\nHarry's He has been especially concerned about him and hopes the King will be well and able to see him as planned.\"\n\nHarry's trip to the UK is his second to Britain this year, after February's trip to see his dad a day after it was announced Charles had cancer. Harry managed to see his ailing father for just 30 minutes at Clarence House. It marked a healing step in their relationship that was dented after Harry and Meghan quit royal life in 2020 and moved to the US. Harry, who stepped back from the royal family in 2020, will make an appearance at the Service of Thanksgiving and stay briefly in the UK before he later joins wife Meghan Markle as the couple make a joint appearance in Nigeria.\n\nFor all the latest on news, politics, sports, and showbiz from the USA, go to The Mirror US.\n\nREAD MORE: Prince Harry's grievances 'pathetic' in face of Kate Middleton's 'very real' problem - expert\n\nREAD MORE: Reason Prince Harry is unlikely to bring Archie and Lilibet to the UK after Meghan Markle snub\n\nPrince Harry is visiting the UK solo for a celebration of the Invictus Games The Duke of Sussex is likely to stay in a London hotel over a royal residence\n\nHarry's UK visit also marks the first time that Harry will have returned to the UK since he flew to the country in February after King Charles' cancer diagnosis was revealed. Harry flew to see his father and was in the country for just 25 hours following the health update, where it was rumoured he saw the King only for a brief 30-minute meeting, which is believed to be their first proper private conversation for 15 months.\n\nDuring his brief stay and despite the royals having a wealth of lavish properties in London, Harry opted to stay in a London hotel instead. He did the same thing when he was in London for the Well Child Awards back in September and it's likely the Duke will again stay in a hotel over a royal residence this week when he stays in the UK. However, there are believed to be rooms at Buckingham Palace, Clarence House, Kensington Palace and Windsor Castle that are typically made available to him should he wish to use them.\n\nIt's been said that a meeting between Harry and his brother Prince William and wife Princess Kate is unlikely\n\nIt was thought that when Harry was in the UK he might meet with his older brother Prince William and Princess Kate, but a meeting has now been ruled out between them. William and Kate - who is currently receiving cancer treatment - are said to have no intention of seeing Harry. An alleged friend of the couple told the Daily Beast: \"Both sides understand each other's position clearly. William and Catherine felt completely betrayed by Harry's memoir. They don't speak to Harry and Meghan, and they are certainly not about to start when Catherine is at her most vulnerable.\"\n\nMeanwhile, an insider told The Mirror's Royal Editor Russel Myers: \"Their relationship remains extremely fractured. {"uri": "8115495435", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-07", "time": "11:57:12", "dateTime": "2024-05-07T11:57:12Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-07T11:56:50Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7450980544090271, "url": "https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/royals/inside-king-charles-prince-harrys-32718416", "title": "Inside Prince Harry and King's potential reconciliation after '30 minute' snub", "body": "Much has been made of Prince Harry's return to the UK this week - specifically, whether or not he will reunite with members of his family.\n\nHarry is back in London for a special service at St Paul's Cathedral on Wednesday to mark the 10th anniversary of the Invictus Games, where he will deliver a reading. Amid his strained relationship with the royals, none are expected to attend the celebration - but what about behind closed doors?\n\nThere has been speculation that Harry will spend some time with his father, the King. The father-and-son relationship has become fraught following Harry's decision to step down as a working royal, and the allegations made in his tell-all memoir, Spare.\n\nPrince Harry saw his father earlier this year during a fleeting visit The pair back in 2019\n\nLast week, a source told the Mirror: \"Harry has kept in regular contact with his father on several occasions and made no secret of his desire to see him when he can. He has been especially concerned about him and hopes the King will be well and able to see him as planned.\"\n\nRoyal sources insisted that despite having a busy diary this week, Charles intends to see his estranged son. Aides said his movements are dependent on how he is feeling on any day. Harry's contact with his dad has \"remained positive\", a source revealed.\n\nThey last saw each other in February after the King's cancer diagnosis was made public. Harry flew back to the UK but only spent 30 minutes with his father on the whirlwind trip, which saw him spend just over 24 hours in his home country.\n\nHarry went straight to Clarence House to see King Charles and he was photographed arriving at his father's residence at about 3.15 in the afternoon with a police escort. Yet just 30 minutes later, the King and Queen were seen waving to crowds as they left Clarence House, signifying that the meeting between father and son was over and didn't last long.\n\nFollowing that fleeting visit, Harry told US TV that he was lucky to spend time with his dad and talked about how ill health could have a reunifying effect on families.\n\nHarry and Meghan with Charles at Trooping the Colour in 2018\n\nOn Wednesday, the day of the Invictus service, Charles is scheduled to have his weekly audience with the Prime Minister before attending the first Buckingham Palace garden party of the season, medical advice permitting. He is also understood to have various appointments and engagements scheduled for the rest of the week.\n\nNevertheless, Harry will no doubt hope to see his father again, should their diaries permit. And it is thought that Charles will make time to see him if he is able. Royal author Ingrid Seward believes Harry will reunite with his father as the King will want to \"make an effort to see his son\".\n\nDuring an appearance on GB News, Ingrid said: \"I don't think we're going to see William and Harry together. But I do think that King Charles will make an effort to see his son. He'll want to see him. They'll both be in London at the same time, I believe, because it's the Prime Minister's meeting. So there is no real reason why Harry shouldn't see his father.\"\n\nGiven that Harry and Meghan live permanently in the UK, Charles rarely gets the opportunity to see his grandchildren, Archie and Lilibet. Just like the late Queen, he met Lilibet for the first time in June 2022 when the Sussexes travelled back to Britain for the Platinum Jubilee. To date, it remains the only time they have met in person.\n\nHarry's has had a rocky relationship with his royal relatives\n\nThat meeting was reportedly \"very emotional\" for Charles, not least because it was the Duke and Duchess of Sussex's first visit to the UK since they stepped down from royal duties and moved to the US in 2020, taking their young son Archie with them.\n\nA senior royal source was quoted as saying that Charles and Camilla were delighted to see Harry and Meghan in the UK again. \"The Prince and the Duchess were absolutely thrilled to see them. The Prince, of course, hasn't seen his grandson Archie for a bit of time and so it was very, very, very special to have some time with him. He hadn't met Lili, his granddaughter, and so to meet her was very emotional, a very, very wonderful thing.\"\n\nSince then, relations between the Sussexes and the rest of the royal family have become more distant. Citing security concerns, Harry and Meghan have chosen not to return with their children since June 2022; the couple later attended the Queen's funeral together, while Harry went to Charles's Coronation on his own. Similarly, he has been alone for his visits to London for court hearings.\n\nThe King made his return to public duties just last week after taking some time out for his cancer treatment. He poignantly met fellow cancer patients and bravely told them how he felt receiving his own diagnosis.\n\nCharles candidly described the experience of being told he had the disease when he visited University College Hospital Macmillan Cancer Centre in London, and he also reassured those who asked about the state of his health, saying \"I'm well\" during his first public-facing event since being diagnosed in early February.\n\nThe head of state went on impromptu walkabouts meeting staff at the centre who had stopped to catch a glimpse of the couple. He sympathised with one cancer patient as she received her chemotherapy with many others in a day unit, telling Lesley Woodbridge, 63 as he held her hand: \"It's always a bit of a shock isn't it, when they tell you.\" A clearly emotional Charles went on to say: \"I've got to have my treatment this afternoon as well.\"\n\nBuckingham Palace recently confirmed that the King is still undergoing cancer treatment and it was too early to say how long it would continue. But a spokesperson said: \"His Majesty's medical team are very encouraged by the progress made so far and remain positive about the King's continued recovery\". Charles' diary of forthcoming events will not be a full summer programme, with his attendance announced nearer the time \"subject to doctors' advice\", according to the Palace.\n\nDo you have a story to sell? For the anniversary of the Invictus Games, Harry returns to his old home, although he usually cites security concerns as the reason he cannot be in Great Britain more often.\n\nThere could have been many reasons why Harry had come to London. King Charles III and Harry's sister-in-law and Princess Kate are both suffering from cancer, with at least Charles reportedly visiting Harry briefly in February.\n\nBut now it's clear: there will be no meeting with his father on Harry's final trip to London. 'There's been much media speculation that father and son would meet. While that always looked like guessing, I'd have guessed they would meet too.'\n\nHarry is understood to have various Invictus Games commitments today, according to ITV . Tomorrow, he is set to give a reading at a service of thanksgiving at St Paul's Cathedral marking a decade since the inaugural competition in London in 2014.\n\nPrince Harry at Armoury House in London this afternoon for an Invictus Games discussion called 'Realising a Global Community' hosted by Louise Minchin, ahead of the service\n\nHarry at Armoury House in London today for an Invictus Games panel with Louise Minchin\n\nHarry at Armoury House in London today for an Invictus Games panel with Louise Minchin\n\nPrince Harry at Armoury House in London this afternoon for an Invictus Games discussion\n\nPrince Harry is seen at Armoury House in London today attending an Invictus Games event\n\nOrganisers had said there was no confirmation of any other royals attending, or if Harry's wife Meghan Markle or children Archie and Lilibet would also be in the UK.\n\nBut Harry arrived in London by himself today, and is expected to join the Duchess on a tour to Nigeria later this week with Meghan set to fly there from the US by herself.\n\nAnd Harry is not anticipated to see his brother Prince William , who is scheduled to be away from the capital on Thursday and Friday, or his sister-in-law Kate Middleton whose cancer treatment continues following her revealing the diagnosis in March.\n\nEarlier today, Charles was photographed being driven from Windsor Castle before arriving at Clarence House in London soon after. today\n\nQueen Camilla is also seen arriving at Clarence House in London this morning\n\nKing Charles III waves as he is driven away from Clarence House in London this morning\n\nKing Charles III is father and son will be able to meet.\n\nAlthough Charles has been left wounded by his son's behaviour in recent years, he has always privately insisted he will keep the door open for him to at least speak.\n\nWilliam, however, is understood to find his brother's betrayal more difficult to forgive or even put to one side.\n\nThe Prince and Princess of Wales will be at Windsor where they have asked for privacy so that Kate can focus on her recovery from serious abdominal surgery and ongoing preventative chemotherapy for the cancer that was subsequently discovered.\n\nIt will be Harry's first Harry is due to attend a special service at St Paul's Cathedral to mark the 10th anniversary of the Invictus Games. And the King, who has just returned to public duties following his cancer diagnosis, is at Buckingham Palace today for meetings and an expected appearance at a garden party.\n\nDuring his visit to Britain, it had been thought Harry could meet with his father, with whom he has a rocky bond, but it seems it is not possible. Charles - still receiving treatment for cancer and having recently returned to limited public duties - has numerous legitimate excuses that exempt him from a rendezvous.\n\n\"Meanwhile Harry's spokesperson insisted the Duke 'is of course understanding of his father's diary of commitments and various other priorities.' Ouch. Many will say the Prince brought all this on himself.\n\n\"Why should the frail King prioritise his youngest son? Instead, the Duke will give a reading in St Paul's Cathedral, the epic venue of his parents' fated wedding, with no significant members of the royal family by his side.\n\n\"It is painfully ironic that Harry is back in London, working for a good cause, in a venue intrinsically associated with the British royal family. There he will see that beyond all the mistakes and pain, Harry, in his capacity as Invictus founder and inspiration, continues to change lives for the better. Harry's old regiment.\n\nIf that wasn't a big enough sting for Harry, then the fact that King Charles' turned down seeing him during his UK visit, but has made time to honor William, may certainly be.\n\nLast night, the Buckingham Palace announcement that the king would pass on the Colonel role he held for 31 years to William, came just two hours after he said he was too busy to see his youngest son.\n\nPrince Harry and Father King Charles III's Ups and Downs Through the Years\n\nTheir statement read: \"At the Army Aviation Centre in Middle Wallop, His Majesty The King will officially hand over the role of Colonel-in-Chief of the Army Air Corps to His Royal Highness The Prince of Wales.\n\n\"In August 2023, following His Majesty's Accession, The King was pleased to announce military appointments including that The Prince of Wales would become Colonel-in-Chief of the Army Air Corps.\n\n\"The role was previously held by His Majesty The King, as Prince of Wales, for 31 years.\"\n\nBefore Prince Harry had decided to step away from royal life, it was thought he would be the one handed the role that would see him take charge of the regiment he toured Afghanistan with until 2014.\n\n\"Timing is everything,\" a royal insider told Daily Mail while another added that Charles' decision not to see Harry despite being only three miles apart \"will be widely perceived as a snub\".\n\nOn Tuesday, Harry was at the Honourable Artillery Company in London appearing participating in a discussion called Realizing Global Community.Charles was just down the road at Clarence House. {"uri": "8116222202", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-07", "time": "20:34:06", "dateTime": "2024-05-07T20:34:06Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-07T20:33:31Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7215686440467834, "url": "https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-13392615/palace-annoucement-joint-engagement-king-charles-prince-william-harry-uk-invictus-games.html", "title": "Palace announces joint engagement between the King and Prince William", "body": "Buckingham Palace has announced a joint engagement between the King and Prince William next week after it emerged Charles will not see his other son Harry during the Duke's UK visit.\n\nPrince Harry met a millionaire financier this evening after admitting King Charles was too busy to meet him in what experts said was a 'snub' that reflected the depth of their rift.\n\nYet now the Palace has announced King Charles will meet with one of his sons - William - on Monday to hand over the role of Colonel-in-Chief of the Army Air Corps to the Prince of Wales.\n\nBuckingham Palace announced today: 'At the Army Aviation Centre in Middle Wallop, His Majesty The King will officially hand over the role of Colonel-in-Chief of the Army Air Corps to His Royal Highness The Prince of Wales.\n\n'In August 2023, following His Majesty's Accession, The King was pleased to announce military appointments including that The Prince of Wales would become Colonel-in-Chief of the Army Air Corps.\n\n'The role was previously held by His Majesty The King, as Prince of Wales, for 31 years.'\n\nPrince Harry, the Duke of Sussex arrived in the UK alone today after flying in from California for a ceremony marking the 10th anniversary of the Invictus Games in London tomorrow.\n\nThe Prince had hoped to meet his estranged father the King during his trip, which follows a previous quick visit in February after Charles's cancer diagnosis. Harry's event was just three miles away from where Charles was, at Clarence House.\n\nBuckingham Palace has announced a joint engagement between the King and Prince William next week after it emerged Charles will not see his other son Harry during the Duke's UK visit\n\nThe Palace has announced King Charles will meet with one of his sons - William - on Monday to hand over the role of Colonel-in-Chief of the Army Air Corps to the Prince of Wales\n\nPrince Harry, patron of the Invictus Games Foundation, on stage during a discussion titled 'Realising a Global Community' at the Honourable Artillery Company in London this afternoon\n\nHarry's spokesman said today: 'In response to the many inquiries and continued speculation on whether or not The Duke will meet with his father while in the UK this week, it unfortunately will not be possible due to His Majesty's full programme.\n\n'The Duke of course is understanding of his father's diary of commitments and various other priorities and hopes to see him soon.'\n\nInstead, as the Duke's foundation Archewell confirmed, he will meet city financier Guy Monson.\n\nReacting to the news, royal expert Richard Fitzwilliams said: 'This, whatever the logistics, will be widely perceived as a snub.\n\n'This is one of the most public rifts in the world. If it was handled in private without so much press speculation, it would have a better chance of being resolved.'\n\nRoyal expert Michael Cole agreed. He said: 'It is quite a snub. For the King to not see his younger son, Prince Harry, although the two men will be only two miles apart tomorrow afternoon, gives an indication of the depth of the divide.\n\n'The Prodigal Son is not welcome - not for the present, anyway. In royal terms, this is big medicine. Prince Harry is bound to see it for what it is, the clearest possible indication of the hurt that has been caused.\n\nThe Duke of Sussex will enjoy dinner this evening with Guy Monson, who attended the unveiling of a statue of Princess Diana in 2021 at Kensington Palace (pictured left, at the unveiling)\n\nInvictus Games Foundation chief executive Dominic Reid and Prince Harry at the Honourable Artillery Company in London this afternoon\n\nKing Charles III is pictured holding papers as he arrives at Clarence House in London today\n\nHarry was three miles away from Charles at the Invictus Games discussion in London today\n\n'There can be no mistake: this is a royal flea in the ear for the fifth in line to the throne. Actions have consequences but rarely are they played out as starkly as they are here.\n\n'Even Prince Harry, never the sharpest sword in the Household Cavalry, is bound to have got the message and many people will say, ''About time too''.'\n\nFellow royal expert Richard Palmer said: 'It's surprising if the King and Harry are not meeting at all and perhaps a sign of how much bridge-building still needs to be done. There's been much media speculation that father and son would meet. While that always looked like guessing, I'd have guessed they would meet too.'\n\nRead More Prince Harry WON'T meet Charles on whistle-stop UK trip due to King's 'full programme' but says 'I hope to see him soon' as he hosts Invictus Games event in London - just three miles away from his father in Clarence House\n\nHarry is understood to have had various Invictus Games commitments today, according to ITV.\n\nMonson, chief investment officer of Sarasin and Partners, a London-based \u00a318billion investment fund, was alongside the warring brothers when they unveiled a statue of their mother Princess Diana in 2021 at Kensington Palace. It was Harry and William's last solo engagement together.\n\nHe was the former treasurer to the Cambridges and the Sussexes' joint foundation before Harry and Meghan quit as senior working royals and emigrated.\n\nPrince Harry at Armoury House in London this afternoon for an Invictus Games discussion called 'Realising a Global Community' hosted by Louise Minchin, ahead of the service\n\nPrince Harry speaks with a member of the Company of Pikemen and Musketeers at the Honourable Artillery Company in London today\n\nHarry at Armoury House in London today for an Invictus Games panel with Louise Minchin\n\nInvictus Games Foundation chief executive Dominic Reid and Prince Harry at the Honourable Artillery Company in London this afternoon\n\nPrince Harry meets Louise Minchin at the Invictus Games event at Armoury House today\n\nHarry was three miles away from Charles at the Invictus Games discussion in London today\n\nMonson is a trustee of the Invictus Games Foundation, founded by Harry, and was on the organising committee for its inaugural games. The Duke revealed he was having dinner with him while sharing an anecdote about the event in 2014.\n\nThe city financier is married to Lady Rose Monson and they have two daughters, Olivia and Leonora.\n\nEducated at the University of Oxford - where he studied a Master's degree in PPE - Mr Monson is chief investment officer of \u00a318billion investment fund Sarasin and Partners.\n\nHe has also served as director of the Chatsworth House Trust, which looks after the iconic stately home in Derbyshire.\n\nRead More ROBERT JOBSON: As Harry jets into the UK again, it would be sensible for King Charles NOT to meet his son... and this is why\n\nTomorrow, the Duke is set to give a reading at a service of thanksgiving at St Paul's Cathedral marking a decade since the inaugural competition in London in 2014.\n\nOrganisers had said there was no confirmation of any other royals attending, or if Harry's wife Meghan Markle or children Archie and Lilibet would also be in the UK.\n\nBut Harry arrived in London by himself today, and is expected to join the Duchess on a tour to Nigeria later this week with Meghan set to fly there from the US by herself.\n\nHarry is also not anticipated to see his brother Prince William , who is scheduled to be away from the capital on Thursday and Friday, or his sister-in-law Kate Middleton whose cancer treatment continues following her revealing the diagnosis in March.\n\nEarlier today, Charles was photographed being driven from Windsor Castle before arriving at Clarence House in London soon after. The King later held an audience nearby at Buckingham Palace with the Prime Minister of Fiji, Sitiveni Rabuka.\n\nThe Duke has invited William and other senior members of the Royal Family to the service but none of them are expected to attend, sources told Page Six in the US.\n\nAmong the royals who could attend include his cousins Zara Tindall and Princesses Beatrice and Eugenie, but there has been no confirmation of this. Harry is expected to stay at a hotel in London because he no longer has Frogmore Cottage in Windsor.\n\nPrince Harry at the Honourable Artillery Company in London this afternoon\n\nHarry at Armoury House in London today for an Invictus Games panel with Louise Minchin\n\nPrince Harry at Armoury House in London this afternoon for an Invictus Games discussion\n\nSir Keith Mills, who helped establish the Invictus Games, greets Prince Harry in London today\n\nPrince Harry is seen at Armoury House in London today attending an Invictus Games event\n\nToday, Harry paid tribute to the Invictus Games family's 'commitment, enthusiasm and belief' and joined an Invictus conference looking back over the past decade.\n\nRead More Prince William will award MBE to mother of Harry's childhood best friend Henry van Straubenzee who died in 2002 car crash aged 18\n\nHarry arrived at the Honourable Artillery Company's headquarters on the edge of the City of London for the one-day summit, called the Invictus Games Foundation Conversation, ahead of tomorrow's service\n\nWriting in the foreword for the summit, Harry said: 'It has been an honour to watch the Invictus Games Foundation grow over the years; what began as a vision to pay tribute to the courage and resilience of wounded, injured, and sick service personnel and veterans, has flourished into an international organisation built on hope, strength, and unity.'\n\nHarry was inspired to found the global tournament after attending the Warrior Games in Colorado in 2013 and seeing how injured American military personnel thrived on the challenge of taking part in competitive sports that aided their recovery.\n\nKing Charles III greets the Prime Minister of Fiji, Sitiveni Rabuka, at Buckingham Palace today\n\nQueen Camilla is also seen arriving at Clarence House in London this morning\n\nKing Charles III waves as he is driven away from Clarence House in London this morning\n\nHe went on to stage the inaugural games in London's Olympic Park in 2014, followed by Orlando in 2016, Toronto in 2017 and Sydney 2018.\n\nOrganisers said after 2020, Invictus will be staged every two years, but The Hague Games planned for that year was delayed by the pandemic until 2022, followed by Dusseldorf 2023, while Vancouver Whistler is planned for 2025.\n\nThe duke wrote: 'As we look ahead to the first winter hybrid Games at Vancouver Whistler 2025 next year, we are eager to celebrate the Invictus Spirit once again - exemplified in every single competitor, staff, friend and family member - your commitment, enthusiasm and belief, have been the driving force behind our continued success.'\n\nHe added: 'Together, we have created a legacy that transcends sports; a community that embraces compassion, respect, and the unyielding belief in the power of the human spirit. As we celebrate this milestone, let us recommit to the Invictus mission.'\n\nKing Charles III leaves Windsor Castle as he heads to Clarence House in London this morning\n\nThe King is driven away from Windsor Castle this morning as he travels to Clarence House\n\nCharles is likely to be in London tomorrow for his usual weekly audience with Prime Minister Rishi Sunak, but it does not appear father and son will be able to meet.\n\nAlthough Charles has been left wounded by his son's behaviour in recent years, he has always privately insisted he will keep the door open for him to at least speak.\n\nRead More Moment beaming Prince Harry excitedly announces birth of his son Archie in footage filmed just months before Megxit - with couple set to celebrate his fifth birthday at home in California\n\nWilliam, however, is understood to find his brother's betrayal more difficult to forgive or even put to one side.\n\nThe Prince and Princess of Wales will be at Windsor where they have asked for privacy so that Kate can focus on her recovery from serious abdominal surgery and ongoing preventative chemotherapy for the cancer that was subsequently discovered.\n\nIt will be Harry's first visit to the UK since February when he returned for a brief trip to see his father the King following his cancer diagnosis.\n\nIt is also the first major event he has attended in Britain for some time and comes amid his ongoing a legal case about his personal security arrangements whenever he is in the UK.\n\nIt will also be Harry's first visit since the Princess of Wales revealed her cancer diagnosis.\n\nExperts say that while he may meet his father the King, he will unlikely meet up with Kate or Prince William.\n\nApril 12, 2024 -- Harry and Meghan at a charity polo match for Sentebale in Wellington, Florida\n\nFebruary 14, 2024 -- Harry and Meghan attend an Invictus Games event in Whistler, Canada\n\nFebruary 6, 2024 -- Prince Harry arrives at Clarence House in London to visit his father Charles\n\nSeptember 16, 2023 -- Prince Harry and Meghan at the Invictus Games in Dusseldorf, Germany\n\nMay 6, 2023 -- Harry leaves Westminster Abbey after the Coronation of Charles and Camilla\n\nRoyal author Tom Bower told MailOnline: 'I'm sure he won't see Kate. I would be surprised if Meghan came.'\n\nFellow royal commentator Richard Fitzwilliams added: 'Catherine is undergoing preventative chemotherapy treatment and given how deep the rift is, to me it seems unlikely.\n\n'The only hope of reconciliation is that it would happen privately and we wouldn't know.'\n\nAnd former BBC royal correspondent Michael Cole said: 'After so much bad blood, it is very difficult indeed to see any sort of reconciliation between the Sussexes and the Royal Family happening (this) week - or for the foreseeable future.'\n\nHarry and Meghan were understood to have made contact with the Prince and Princess of Wales 'privately' after Kate announced her cancer diagnosis.\n\nThey also released a statement, saying: 'We wish health and healing for Kate and the family.'\n\nTomorrow's service at St Paul's, which is expected to run from 5pm until 6pm, will come two days after Harry's son Archie celebrated his fifth birthday yesterday.\n\nActor Damian Lewis is set to recite a poem during the service.\n\nSeptember 14, 2022 -- Harry and Meghan with other royals at the Queen's funeral in London\n\nSeptember 10, 2022 -- William, Kate, Harry and Meghan in Windsor after the Queen's death\n\nJune 3, 2022 -- Harry and Meghan at St Paul's Cathedral following a Platinum Jubilee service\n\nJuly 1, 2021 -- Harry and Meghan at Kensington Palace to unveil a statue of their mother Diana\n\nRepresentatives from across the Invictus Games participating nations, including members of the wounded, injured and sick service personnel and veteran community, will also be in attendance.\n\nREAD MORE Prince Harry's new meeting with King Charles shows a thaw in frosty relations, royal experts say - A spokesperson for the Duke of Sussex stated that King Charles, who recently resumed official duties after battling cancer, was too occupied to meet with his youngest son.\n\n\"The duke of course is understanding of his father's commitments and various other priorities and hopes to see him soon,\" the spokesperson remarked, shedding light on the strained dynamics within the royal family.\n\nHarry's relationship with his family has been tumultuous, especially since stepping back from royal duties in 2020 and relocating to California with his wife, Meghan.\n\nDespite the rift, Harry remains committed to his philanthropic efforts, particularly the Invictus Games, a tournament he founded for wounded troops and veterans. While in London for commemorative events, the absence of a family reunion underscores the lingering tensions within the royal household.\n\nThe last time Prince Harry and Charles saw each other\n\nThe most recent encounter between Prince Harry and Charles occurred in February when the duke hastily traveled to London following His Majesty's undisclosed cancer diagnosis. During this visit, Harry spent less than an hour with Charles, opting to stay overnight in a hotel before departing from London's Heathrow Airport the next day.\n\nThe commemoration of the 10th anniversary of the Invictus Games\n\nHarry is scheduled to attend a service of Thanksgiving at St. Paul's Cathedral on May 8, as part of the commemoration of the 10th anniversary of the Invictus Games.\n\nWhat is Invictus Games?\n\nThe Invictus Games, founded by Harry in 2014, is a Paralympic-style competition for wounded service members. It originated in London as an international version of the U.S. Department of Defense's Warrior Games, which Harry attended in 2013.
